Posts.Content: youngatheart glad to hear not long to wait now your on the road to results , and that nodes look normal, rest up . Wishing you luck xx
Posts.Title: lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy

Posts.Content: Hi Jax68  What a nasty surprise! I think it seems lot of people experience changes as they go along , with more or different things popping up, I went from 1 tumour to 2 at MRI , 4 at pathology.  Try to take comfort in that their obviously being thorough and you don't know for sure what this 2nd lump is yet , it a shame you now have to be waiting on biopsy results again hope this doesn't hold you up getting your treatment started xxx
Posts.Title: 2 nd lump found

Posts.Content: Jax68 how are your lymph nodes looking ? Did I read that they looked ok on scan? You are already prepared for treatment and surgery, so there's no reason to believe that this second lump will make any difference to your plan as yet, I m sure the shock is what's getting to you today, it's been found and will be treated along with the fist lump. Have a scream then look for your positive vibe again, sometimes it's easier to find the negative but remind yourself how well you've been doing. Xxx
Posts.Title: 2 nd lump found

Posts.Content: Good their obviously being very through, I know you'll still worry so hope it's not long until you get more news . Hugs xxx
Posts.Title: 2 nd lump found

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear this ali owl can't begin to imagine how your feeling at this point, I'm frustrated just waiting for a reply from genetics ! Sending hugs xx
Posts.Title: PALB2

Posts.Content: Me too thanks ali owl, you know your strong after what you've been through already but so unfair that you'll need to draw on that strength again, hang in there xxx
Posts.Title: PALB2

Posts.Content: Hi JoJo05 Sorry to hear you have this worry, as you've been told the biopsy will indeed be the definitive result, what I can say is that when I had this process it was indeed a fibroadenoma as they'd expected, I later had mine biopsied again as it continued to grow (Not what they'd expected) was still harmless but they removed it due to the size (No problem, nothing to worry about) 3 years later I was indeed diagnosed with breast cancer ( strong family history) not saying to frighten you but to convey that I got a very different vibe from the room at scan and biopsy, i think the professionals have a good idea of what their looking at .Hopefully they are right and it's a fibroadenoma, try not to worry too much, Thursday not far off good luck xx
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Referral

Posts.Content: That sums it up perfectly ! You couldn't get the knowledge and Caring understanding any where else
Posts.Title: The BC Paradox and a Thank you

Posts.Content: littleone31 my decision was made relatively quickly and easily based on that I personally didn't want a long operation with multiple wounds to heal and being small an implant suited me, however I believe better results can be obtained by other means although I'm fine with my choice.  Think about what's important to you ... I wanted to look ok in a bra, bikin i wasn't worried about naked !  Do you need RT after op, as can affect  implant  I believe. Recon using your own bits! will age better with you however some will use an implant as well . Think about your lifestyle and expectations . I m sure you've had leaflets and done some research, ask anything that is on your mind and be sure that for you it's what you want . What might you find easier to deal with emotionally...  I knew I needed to wake up with a boob !! ( But be prepared to wait for healing to see end results , at first I was a bit shocked thinking it was too big, i was just jumping the gun !)  Now I'm rambling! Hope it's given you food for thought! I know when I go to appointments my head just goes empty maybe jot down your thoughts to take with you.  Good luck xx
Posts.Title: Questions to ask re: mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi charcor you sound like a great daughter, already doing your best for your mum.  I've not got advice for you but just wanted to tell that I was in hospital with a lovely lady of 91 who'd had a mastectomy, she was an inspiration . Hope you have positive advances with your mum's treatment, good luck xxx
Posts.Title: Any advice for worried daughter.

Posts.Content: I can imagine your living through a fog at the moment, I 've got to say I never really asked much before hand but I was offered more scans and biopsies after the MRI showed up the 2nd area and these were the confirmation I needed other than that I didn't want a lot of info it was just how I coped. I'm sure my nurse and surgeons realised this as everything was explained well in understandable terms I always felt safe in their hands, sounds like you feel the same about your team I'm sure you will get all the info you need . Maybe a good thing you have a busy week and have family around you  xx
Posts.Title: Looking for mastectomy buddy

Posts.Content: Hi lindsaybubbles I can imagine your shock, it's a shame that you've already had one op and now face another !  I can only say from my experience I was shocked when after being told I would need a lumpectomy and radiotherapy the MRI showed I actually needed a mastectomy, the pathology then confirmed I had 4 tumours and not the 2 we were expecting, so to my unclinical mind I'd say it's sensible for you to go with mastectomy if that's what's your being advised, I'd rather feel reassured that nothing was left behind. Maybe you'd benefit from talking it through further with your nurse . Hope you can find  reassurance here to come to terms with your situation, it's one that's been faced by many here, your not alone so just ask any questions. Hugs xx
Posts.Title: Looking for mastectomy buddy

Posts.Content: Glad your seeing your nurse on Friday make a list of any questions for her so you don't forget anything you'd like to ask. Maybe reconstruction is on your mind this also is a big decision.  I was relived I'd had a mastectomy when I got the pathology results i knew at that point it was definitely the right operation, your so right no one would say it's easy emotionally but I do feel at peace that I've done the right thing we all have to find a level of acceptance in our situations, not easy, keep talking xxx
Posts.Title: Looking for mastectomy buddy

Posts.Content: This is so confusing !  So I picked up my first precription of tamoxifen yesterday but was told not to start it yet as I've flown recently, I was told to stop  4 wks before and 4wks after. Short flight should be ok ie Paris and to wear flight socks.  On coming home I realised I'm flying again in September so on those guide lines there's no room to start them before I fly again meaning I wouldn't actually get to take my first dose until near end of October.  Going by this if I flew twice a year I'd be having 4 months of no tamoxifen a year which seems odd to me. Every thing I've  read seems to be of different opinion  Will be interested in further replies  Xx
Posts.Title: Flying while on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Resting, I think  my stay probably was due to the weekend, I did see a surgeon on the Saturday briefly but not one of my own (I had 2) then mine turned up on the Monday along with my BCN.I was worried about the drain but it was fine, I was just relived to have the op over as I'm sure you will be. Wishing you all the best for Thursday, you will be fine xxx
Posts.Title: Length of hospital stay

Posts.Content: Hi there resting, Same surgery went well for me got onto ward late Friday evening and went home on Monday afternoon with out drain which had been removed on the Monday,  didn't actually mind the stay felt safe being looked after. Initially I'd be told I was booked in for 36hrs . Good luck xxx
Posts.Title: Length of hospital stay

Posts.Content: Hi there,  I had a mastectomy with imidiate implant reconstruction, it was thought that I wouldn't need radiotherapy.  I didn't want the longer more complicated reconstruction options and being small implant suited me. I belive the other options may give a better result for some but it's a personal choice, I m happy enough with mine,is basically look the same in a bra, it's 6 weeks today, recovery is not so bad, uncomfortable rather than  painful. At my first dressing change there was a area that wasn't healing well but stronger antibiotics sorted that out and within 5 days at the next check all was well . Hope you can make a decision a little easier ! It is a tough one . Good luck  Hugs xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Choices....Any Thoughts?

Posts.Content: Kaz18 I remember it well, but 4 months on I'm back to normal ! Well a new normal ! Try and keep the end goal in sight, whatever your treatment plan you'll get through it, it does seem easier when you know what you've got ahead. Good luck for tomorrow xxx
Posts.Title: MRI results & surgery / treatment plan tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi there  Try not to Google too much I know it's hard but you will scare yourself, urgent referal is normal as far as I'm aware, in my area that usually means an appointment within 2 weeks which does feel like forever when it's you waiting but you will be thoroughly checked out and hopefully it will be nothing to worry about , breast clinics are busy places sadly but a lot of ladies are there with various lumps and bumps that aren't a big problem. All you can do is keep busy while your waiting, hopefully you have a trusted friend or partner that can go along when you get your appointment . Try and stay calm ish !! Xxx
Posts.Title: Fast track referral to breast clinic

Posts.Content: OCRKate This man's disgusting behaviour has made me so angry, facing your battle with cancer should be your only concern,  please take the advice of others and don't let this vile man affect your choice of treatment.  Please take some advice maybe start with citizens advice, I really wouldn't know how to tackle the situation but this man is a bully, if he treats you like this it's most likely he treats other women the same , I'll stop ranting,  glad you're seeking support in this problem and just wanted to add mine . Hugs and thoughts with you xx
Posts.Title: Potentially stupid question - Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Definitely not alone OCRKate here to listen and there's usually good advice from someone who's been through similar. Good luck for your appointment on Monday hope it is just radiotherapy your facing although I'm sure that's not an easy route especially with added stress !  Let us know how it goes xxx
Posts.Title: Potentially stupid question - Chemotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi all, Just wondering if anyone is using an online pharmacy and how your getting on with it? in respect of getting the same brand of tamoxifen each time ? My pharmacy has been supplying wockhardt, which I've had for 6 of the 7 months I've been on them, seem to be getting on ok and wouldn't want to swap and change all the time. Any info would be much appreciated.  Hope your all doing as you can be xx
Posts.Title: Pharmacy 2U

Posts.Content: Gdpt I m doing fine thanks and have a lovely granddaughter,  I'm out the other side now  so to speak ! I've learnt a lot from this forum and I hope although i can't tell you  everything will be fine you 'll take some comfort that you can get through it , it is a  very emotional time and your family are all probably doing the same as you worrying that they'll  upset others by talking about it but you can talk positively about how you will support your mum through it , there's always someone listening hear . Enjoy the farm and try and  stay calm Hugs xx
Posts.Title: My mum has just been diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Gdpt morning, sorry that this worry has brought you here but the fact so many of us post here shows how common breast cancer is sadly, but also how good the survival rate is the treatments aren't easy but people get through it . Unfortunately you don't really know what your dealing with until the biopsy results and we all agree the waiting is the hardest , hopefully you have an appointment not too far off for results . My daughter was pregnant when I was diagnosed, so I can guarantee your mum is as worried about the effect on you as you are worried about her, be open and honest with each other and also try and just do some nice things during the waiting time . Also I'd say from my pathology results there were 4 tumours discovered not the just tbe 2 we had expected but no spread to my lymph nodes so hopefully for your mum this is the case, numerous tumours and size don't necessarily mean a worse case scenario I believe.  Glad you've  found a safe  place to chat about your concerns for now try and stay calm sending luck and a hug xxx
Posts.Title: My mum has just been diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Gdpt good to hear from you, shame your still in the waiting phase but glad to hear you have more confidence in your mum's team this is sure to help a little whatever the results.  Hope your looking after yourself as well, hang in there! Xxx
Posts.Title: My mum has just been diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Flyfree I've had the same apart from mine was a permanent implant straight off, I found recovery uncomfortable at your stage rather than painful I d say but I was very limited at 4wks as to what I could do , maybe the expander is more painful I wouldn't know . It is early days for you though so be kind to yourself , you've been through an awful lot. I'm 4 months post op now all is well, though I know when I've done a little too much. Hope things settle down for you soon xx
Posts.Title: Skin sparing mastectomy and pre pectoral ADM augmented reconstruction...

Posts.Content: Not_half Hi there,  Just wondered if I could ask you if you've made any progress with genetic testing yet ? I was refered to genetics in March, told it could take a while , I heard from them in may asking to access my mum's medical records but no more as yet. BCN said to give it a couple more months and if no news she 'll chase it.  I find it hard having this ongoin.  Hope you've made progress with it . Xx
Posts.Title: Axillary tail lump.

Posts.Content: Thanks Eddiboy  good outcome for you glad your family will now be monitored more closely , it's a little reassurance. That's what I'm thinking myself, I've given all family history and presumably they've now acsesed my mum's medical history,  I just hope I do get to testing stage, slightly worried it'll come back that they don't need to test . Worried either way to be honest . My mum was 43 at diagnosis,  maternal aunt 60 and myself 48 . Hopefully I 'll hear something soon it feels like the last hurdle don't think it'll stop you worring whatever the outcome but I need the knowledge!  Hope your as well as can be xxx
Posts.Title: Axillary tail lump.

Posts.Content: Disney8042 Sorry to hijack your post with my question. hoping all turns out well for you and there's no cause for concern in the end, understandably it's a nerve racking experience for you, wishing you well xxx Not_half Thanks for your reply didn't realise we're on opposite sides of the world,  I'll just have to be patient at least it's being dealt with. Wishing you well xx
Posts.Title: Axillary tail lump.
